item.title: Sanhua Falls in Hong Kong Debut After $1.2 Billion Listing
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- Zhejiang Sanhua Intelligent Controls Co., the Chinese maker of fridge parts that’s working on becoming a cutting-edge robotics company, declined during its Hong Kong trading debut after its HK$9.3 billion ($1.2 billion) debut stock offering. The shares opened at HK$20.95 each on Monda...

item.title: Euro-Area Economy Needs More ECB Stimulus, Centeno Tells Stampa
item.author: Bloomberg News (English)
item.description: (Bloomberg) -- The European Central Bank needs to provide the euro-area economy with “further stimulus,” Governing Council member Mario Centeno told Italy’s La Stampa. “The level of rates must be compatible with an economy that generates stable inflation at 2%,” the Portuguese central bank chief was...
